page.title: 10MORLEY HILL FARM
page.content: {Morley Hill}farm was the first of a number of farms which we surveyed. Questions for the farmer were asked concerning his land use etc. First we ask how much{cultivated}he owned which turned out to be 20 acres and along with this 100 acres of grazing land. The farmland we expected would have woodland on it but surprisingly it did not. From other questions we found out that the farmer and labourers worked from 8.00am to 5.00pm on his 120 acres of land.{Livestock}is also kept on the farm and a vast 100 acres is used for grazing cows, sheep, horses, hens and geese. From this livestock, meat products are sold to D&G Haswell butchers but funny enough the farmer does not slaughter his own animals. The farmer also did not use {pesticides}and did not get any yield. Crops of wheat and barley are grown.
